connector.description: Store and retrieve objects from AWS S3 Storage Service using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Client.name: camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Client
camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Client.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry.

camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Presigner.name: camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Presigner
camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Presigner.description: An S3 Presigner for Request, used mainly in createDownloadLink operation

camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket
camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName. This will apply also in case of moveAfterRead option enabled and it will create the destinationBucket if it doesn't exist already.

camel.source.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.name: camel.source.endpoint.overrideEndpoint
camel.source.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.source.endpoint.pojoRequest.name: camel.source.endpoint.pojoRequest
camel.source.endpoint.pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

camel.source.endpoint.policy.name: camel.source.endpoint.policy
camel.source.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.source.endpoint.region.name: camel.source.endpoint.region
camel.source.endpoint.region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificat.name: camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificat.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.source.endpoint.uriEndpointOverrid.name: camel.source.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride
camel.source.endpoint.uriEndpointOverrid.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.source.endpoint.useDefaultCredenti.name: camel.source.endpoint.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.source.endpoint.useDefaultCredenti.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.source.endpoint.customerAlgorithm.name: camel.source.endpoint.customerAlgorithm
camel.source.endpoint.customerAlgorithm.description: Define the customer algorithm to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.source.endpoint.customerKeyId.name: camel.source.endpoint.customerKeyId
camel.source.endpoint.customerKeyId.description: Define the id of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.source.endpoint.customerKeyMD5.name: camel.source.endpoint.customerKeyMD5
camel.source.endpoint.customerKeyMD5.description: Define the MD5 of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from S3 after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the AWS2S3Constants#BUCKET_NAME and AWS2S3Constants#KEY headers, or only the AWS2S3Constants#KEY header.

camel.source.endpoint.delimiter.name: camel.source.endpoint.delimiter
camel.source.endpoint.delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucket.name: camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucket
camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucket.description: Define the destination bucket where an object must be moved when moveAfterRead is set to true.

camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucketP.name: camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucketPrefix
camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucketP.description: Define the destination bucket prefix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucketS.name: camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucketSuffix
camel.source.endpoint.destinationBucketS.description: Define the destination bucket suffix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

camel.source.endpoint.doneFileName.name: camel.source.endpoint.doneFileName
camel.source.endpoint.doneFileName.description: If provided, Camel will only consume files if a done file exists.

camel.source.endpoint.fileName.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileName
camel.source.endpoint.fileName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given file name

camel.source.endpoint.includeBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeBody
camel.source.endpoint.includeBody.description: If it is true, the S3Object exchange will be consumed and put into the body and closed. If false the S3Object stream will be put raw into the body and the headers will be set with the S3 object metadata. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true because the S3Object stream will be consumed then it will also be closed in case of includeBody false then it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. However setting autocloseBody to true when includeBody is false it will schedule to close the S3Object stream automatically on exchange completion.

camel.source.endpoint.includeFolders.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeFolders
camel.source.endpoint.includeFolders.description: If it is true, the folders/directories will be consumed. If it is false, they will be ignored, and Exchanges will not be created for those

camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections
camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections.description: Set the maxConnections parameter in the S3 client configuration

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. The default value is 10. Use 0 or a negative number to set it as unlimited.

camel.source.endpoint.moveAfterRead.name: camel.source.endpoint.moveAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from S3 bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

camel.source.endpoint.prefix.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefix
camel.source.endpoint.prefix.description: The prefix which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.autocloseBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.autocloseBody
camel.source.endpoint.autocloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is false, then the S3Object.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to false and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.component.aws2-s3.amazonS3Client.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.amazonS3Client
camel.component.aws2-s3.amazonS3Client.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry.

camel.component.aws2-s3.amazonS3Presigne.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.amazonS3Presigner
camel.component.aws2-s3.amazonS3Presigne.description: An S3 Presigner for Request, used mainly in createDownloadLink operation

camel.component.aws2-s3.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.autoCreateBucket
camel.component.aws2-s3.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName. This will apply also in case of moveAfterRead option enabled and it will create the destinationBucket if it doesn't exist already.

camel.component.aws2-s3.overrideEndpoint.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.overrideEndpoint
camel.component.aws2-s3.overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.component.aws2-s3.pojoRequest.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.pojoRequest
camel.component.aws2-s3.pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

camel.component.aws2-s3.policy.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.policy
camel.component.aws2-s3.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyPort.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-s3.region.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.region
camel.component.aws2-s3.region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.aws2-s3.trustAllCertific.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-s3.trustAllCertific.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-s3.uriEndpointOverr.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.uriEndpointOverride
camel.component.aws2-s3.uriEndpointOverr.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.component.aws2-s3.useDefaultCreden.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.component.aws2-s3.useDefaultCreden.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws2-s3.customerAlgorith.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.customerAlgorithm
camel.component.aws2-s3.customerAlgorith.description: Define the customer algorithm to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.component.aws2-s3.customerKeyId.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.customerKeyId
camel.component.aws2-s3.customerKeyId.description: Define the id of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.component.aws2-s3.customerKeyMD5.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.customerKeyMD5
camel.component.aws2-s3.customerKeyMD5.description: Define the MD5 of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.component.aws2-s3.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.aws2-s3.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.aws2-s3.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.deleteAfterRead
camel.component.aws2-s3.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from S3 after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the AWS2S3Constants#BUCKET_NAME and AWS2S3Constants#KEY headers, or only the AWS2S3Constants#KEY header.

camel.component.aws2-s3.delimiter.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.delimiter
camel.component.aws2-s3.delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucke.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucket
camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucke.description: Define the destination bucket where an object must be moved when moveAfterRead is set to true.

camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucke.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucketPrefix
camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucke.description: Define the destination bucket prefix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucke.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucketSuffix
camel.component.aws2-s3.destinationBucke.description: Define the destination bucket suffix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

camel.component.aws2-s3.doneFileName.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.doneFileName
camel.component.aws2-s3.doneFileName.description: If provided, Camel will only consume files if a done file exists.

camel.component.aws2-s3.fileName.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.fileName
camel.component.aws2-s3.fileName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given file name

camel.component.aws2-s3.includeBody.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.includeBody
camel.component.aws2-s3.includeBody.description: If it is true, the S3Object exchange will be consumed and put into the body and closed. If false the S3Object stream will be put raw into the body and the headers will be set with the S3 object metadata. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true because the S3Object stream will be consumed then it will also be closed in case of includeBody false then it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. However setting autocloseBody to true when includeBody is false it will schedule to close the S3Object stream automatically on exchange completion.

camel.component.aws2-s3.includeFolders.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.includeFolders
camel.component.aws2-s3.includeFolders.description: If it is true, the folders/directories will be consumed. If it is false, they will be ignored, and Exchanges will not be created for those

camel.component.aws2-s3.moveAfterRead.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.moveAfterRead
camel.component.aws2-s3.moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from S3 bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

camel.component.aws2-s3.prefix.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.prefix
camel.component.aws2-s3.prefix.description: The prefix which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.component.aws2-s3.autocloseBody.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.autocloseBody
camel.component.aws2-s3.autocloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is false, then the S3Object.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to false and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

camel.component.aws2-s3.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-s3.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
